On 7/3/07, Yohanes Santoso <yahoo-rest-discuss@...> wrote:
> What other reasons are there?

It seems to be to the benefit of spammers to throw out as much chaff
as possible - if they can get legit sites blacklisted as often as
possible, the legit sites will take care of the task of getting rid of
the blacklist for them. So if you can cheaply feed your whole spam
list into web forms, you do it.

Also, if you *can* get people to authenticate your web board (for
instance) account and it's permitted you to set your own password,
then you get to spam the web board.

The "just because" factor is surprisingly significant, too.
